choices.C: A Spring bean can be implicitly created by annotating the class with @Bean and using the component-scanner to scan its package.
choices.B: A Spring bean can be implicitly created by annotating the class with @Component and using the component-scanner to scan its package.
choices.A: A Spring bean can be explicitly created by annotating methods or fields by @Autowired.
choices.D: A Spring bean can be explicitly created using @Bean annotated methods within a Spring configuration class.
choices.E: A Spring bean can be explicitly created by annotating the class with @Autowired.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D

why not B and D ?

@Autowired is used for dependency injection so E from my point of view is not correct

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true regarding bean creation? (Choose two.)
What are the two reasons Spring be used to build a Java application? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Spring provides abstractions over infrastructure such as persistence and messaging.
choices.C: Spring automates deployment of Java applications to all of the major cloud providers.
choices.B: Spring provides a Dependency Injection container.
choices.D: Spring provides comprehensive Java IDE support.
choices.A: Spring automates a Java application build.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
B. Spring provides a Dependency Injection container.

True. One of the core features of Spring is its powerful Dependency Injection (DI) container, which helps manage the lifecycle and dependencies of the applicationâ€™s components.

E. Spring provides abstractions over infrastructure such as persistence and messaging.

True. Spring provides a range of abstractions over various infrastructure concerns, such as persistence (with Spring Data and JPA), messaging (with Spring JMS and Spring AMQP), transaction management, and more. These abstractions simplify and unify the way developers interact with these systems.

Selected Answer: BE
what the others say

B and E are correct.
A is wrong, spring itself does not automate the build process of Java applications. Build automation tools like Maven or Gradle are commonly used for automating the build process.
C is wrong, spring provides integrations with various cloud platforms and services, but it does not automate the deployment process to all major cloud providers. 
D is wrong, while Spring does provide integration with Java IDEs, comprehensive Java IDE support is not a specific feature of the Spring framework itself.

B and E.

A. Wrong because Spring is a framework that provides infrastructure support to build Java applications but not automate build process

comments.content: Spring Cloud framework offer support not to all major Cloud providers , and it does not automate the entire deployment process

discussion.content: Why is C is not correct

B and D are correct.
A is false. JdbcTemplate handles SQLExceptions internally, converting them to Spring's DataAccessException hierarchy, which makes it unnecessary for you to catch SQLExceptions explicitly.
C is false. JdbcTemplate can perform both insert and update operations. It supports a wide range of database operations, including insertion, update, deletion, and querying.
E is false. JdbcTemplate does not generate SQL statements. Instead, it allows you to execute SQL statements that you provide. It does not generate SQL statements automatically

Selected Answer: BD
E is false. JdbcTemplate does not generate SQL statements. Instead, it allows you to execute SQL statements that you provide.

D - This is true because Spring's JdbcTemplate class offers a variety of methods to execute SQL queries against a relational database. These include methods for executing SQL queries (query, queryForObject, queryForList, etc.), updates (update), and batch operations (batchUpdate).

questions.question_text: Which two statements describe Spring JdbcTemplate? (Choose two.)

choices.D: The JdbcTemplate provides methods for query execution.
choices.C: The JdbcTemplate can only perform update but not insert to the database.
choices.B: The JdbcTemplate provides the ability to work with result sets.
choices.A: All JdbcTemplate methods throw SQLException which you are required to handle.

discussion.content:
The answer is correct.
A is incorrect because it only supports method calls
B is correct as it is just an expression to select joints
C is incorrect as it doesn't change any behavior
D is incorrect as it doesn't execute any code.

questions.question_text: Which statement defines a pointcut? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.D: Code to be executed at each selected join point.
choices.B: An expression that selects one or more join points.
choices.A: A point in the execution of a program such as a method call or field assignment.

questions.question_text: Which statement describes the propagation behavior of Propagation.REQUIRES_NEW annotation? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.C: Starts a new transaction; if an active transaction already exists, it is suspended.
choices.A: Starts a new transaction but throws an exception if an active transaction already exists.
choices.D: Runs in a nested transaction if an active transaction exists; throws an exception if an active transaction does not exist.
choices.B: Joins a transaction if one already exists; throws an exception if an active transaction does not exist.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
for explanation of REQUIRES_NEW, see https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/reference/data-access/transaction/declarative/tx-propagation.html#tx-propagation-requires_new

for all enum values and their meanings, see https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/6.2.1/javadoc-api/org/springframework/transaction/annotation/Propagation.html
